text:
Hands down it is the best cheesecake on the site. Just stunning visually and so good. I couldn't make it as much as I would like (It is a bit costly) but when I can it gets many raves. I don't change anything about it and it didnt crack. You must be very careful and make sure not to open the oven at any time. You must be careful with a cheesecake. Baking/desserts in general are very specific and you have to make sure everything is done right. It's an art really. Anyway my husband loves this cheesecake and recently asked me to bake it again. When he asks for cheesecake this is the one I do. Far from wimpy, heavy as can be, which is not a bad thing, fluffy (the weight not the taste) and just so rich and good. 

I top my with raspberries (canned glaze and then a few fresh ones on top)

Perfection

text:
When the other reviewers say you can't mess this up- they are right. I set mine in a water bath, let it sit in the oven for 2 hours after baking, and it turned out perfect.  I've never made such a thick cheesecake that wasn't undercooked in the middle, or cracked before, but this recipe seemed to be the magic key to a great tasting, and picture perfect cheesecake.  The only change I made was to add some lemon juice to the batter.  Next time I think I might also omit the flour to get more of a creamy texture.  Will make again!

I just recently made this recipe for Easter. I'm 17 and I would call myself a good cook/baker so i like to try new recipes and see how they turn out and just like the other reviews implied this cheesecake was great. It had a nice creamy texture and a very nice flavor. Its a fairly simple recipe. I tweaked it a lil and put the batter in a pre-made gramhn cracker crust because i dont have a springform pan and i let it cool for 2 hours instead of 6. It didn't have any cracks. This is my first time making a "plain" cheesecake from scratch and it was just excellent. I usually make a chocolate, tutle, or marbled cheesecake, but i will definatly make this again. Thanks for an awesome recipe.

text:
It seems like gilding the lily to pile yet more praise on this one but I will anyway.  I made the recipe as written except for using cinnamon graham crackers for the crust and adding the grated zest of 1/2 a lemon (I like the little bit of brightness it adds).  I put a pan of water below and it turned out beautifully - no cracks, just a hint of golden brown around the outside of the top, and no sinking.  A+ work, Chantal - thanks for this one!

text:
I have made several cheesecakes and not one of them has ever turned out as well as this recipe did.  I followed the directions exactly as written. I used the waterbath, wrapped the bottom in foil, and when it was done cooking I turned the oven off I left it in there overnight to cool. I have never heard of doing this before and it turned out to be the secret to a beautiful perfect looking cheesecake. Not one Crack!! I also substituted the Bailey's Irish Cream for the milk. The Baileys was a great idea!! It gave it an amazing bite, great flavor. ,My guests couldn't stop talking about it. This recipe is a keeper!!!

text:
I made this cake the night before my bday dinner party. Considering this was the first time I ever made a cheesecake it tunred out excellent. I followed the directions exactly only I also put it in a water bath in the oven for an hour then turned the oven off and left it overnight in there (I went to bed at midnight. It was perfectly baked and had a nice consitency. The top was not nicley browned however, which was ok since I spead Strawberry preserves on top. My guests loved it and so did I. This is a keeper. One tip is to really have all your ingredients at room temperature. Especially the cream cheese. I had small bits of cream cheese that did not mix well because it was too cold.

text:
Chantal, you have given me a gem!!!  I love this cheesecake.  The basic recipe is excellent for all of your variations and additions.  Beautiful in appearance and delicious, too.  I used 1/3 less fat cream cheese and 'light' sour cream with this recipe and it turned out just as creamy as the full fat.  A girlfriend said, "this tastes restaurant bought".  I did use a waterbath, cooked for 1 hour and then cooled in the oven for 6hours (overnight).  I had a small crack in the center, but it gave it character.  My husband said it was ALMOST too pretty to eat.  Thanks for a great recipe!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677176.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is the best cheesecake recipe I've ever tried, and I won't try another one again.  It's absolutely perfect.

I make the crust with 12 graham crackers instead of 15, and with a teaspoon of cinnamon.  Also - this cheesecake will not crack if your ingredients are at room temperature when you begin, you place your springform pan (wrapped in foil) in a waterbath, and let it sit for several hours (4-6) before you take it out of the oven.  Just turn the oven off and forget about it, and then put your cheesecake in the fridge to chill.  This is perfect for company, birthdays, to bring to dinner parties, etc!  Just wonderful.

text:
This is a very good, very easy recipe!  I didn't have the sour cream, so I had to subsitute.  I took lowfat Cottage Cheese and pureed it, then added it instead of the sour cream.  Worked like a charm.  A tip for perfect cheesecake... line bottom of spring form pan with aluminum foil, put pan in a bigger pan, like a roasting pan, and fill the outside of the spring form pan with hot water, so cheesecake will cook evenly.

text:
it almost feels redundant to add yet another five star rating to this cheesecake....but it's really good! it's a bit 'lighter' than other cheesecakes (my guess would be the milk?); it's got a very soft, creamy texture rather than the typical dense, moist 'crumb' of your average cheesecake. truth be told, i don't necessarily prefer this one, but it's certainly delicious! to fill a friend's request, i made it with a chocolate crumb crust, and added caramel, chocolate chips and pecans. using a bain marie, the cake neither browned nor cracked. a recipe worth keeping. :-)

userID:
2640745
Display Name:
Jeanette
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
17
favoritesCount:
75
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/20.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Fabulous!  The only changes I made to the ingredients were:  made a graham cracker crust from the recipe off the Honey Maid box and reduced the flour to 3 Tbsp.  I sprayed the sides and bottom of 9 inch springform pan very well and the crust came off the sides without any problems.  I baked the cheesecake in a water bath after placing the springform pan in a baking bag (didn't use foil).  I preheated the oven to 350 and when I put the cheesecake in I reduced the temp to 325.  Baked it one hour and about 15 minutes and then reduced the temp to 250 and baked it about 35 min more.  Then I turned the oven off and let the cheesecake cool in the oven (without opening the door) for about 3 hours.  I was worried during this time because the cheesecake wasn't brown on top and looked undone, though it did not jiggle in the middle at all.  After 3 hours, I took it out and ran a knife around the edges (the edges were already basically pulled away from the sides of the pan) and opened the spring form pan.  Beautiful with no cracks.  Topped it with crushed Reeses mini pb cups and  a peanut butter glaze.  Refigerated it overnite and have been enjoying it all day long!  Try this recipe, I think it is the best on this site.  Will be making another one tonight to give as a gift.

None
text:
Reading the reviews, I noted that most of the complaints were about lack of flavor so I added the zest of 1 lemon and 1/4 teaspoon lemon extract.  The flavor and texture were wonderful.

I made this using the suggested tips of having my ingredients at room temp and putting the pan in a water bath.  At 50 minutes, I ran a knife around the edge of the pan and closed the oven.  At 60 minutes I turned off the oven and left the cheesecake in for 3 hours.  When I checked on it, it was gorgeous!  I left it on the counter for another hour before refrigerating.  No cracks.

Will make this again and again.

text:
This truly is the perfect cheesecake recipe.  I subbed Bailey's for milk and added 1/2 cup chocolate chips over the crust and 1/2 cup chips on top of the cake.  I used a waterbath and would strongly recommend adding more butter to the crust.  I used a stick.  The crumbs don't hold together without all that buttery goodness.  I will never EVER trust another cheesecake recipe.  This is THE BEST.

city:

region:
None
country:

text:
Okay, this was my first cheesecake that didn’t come from a box that said “Jell-O No Bake”, and I did surprisingly well! I did make mistakes though... so you can sort of redeem yourself. Well I followed other suggestions and made sure everything was room temperature … I forgot about the bowl though (its metal- and it was ice cold)... and I started getting lumps almost immediately. But I figured I might as well keep going and I followed all the other suggestions regarding mixing with a wooden spoon instead of an electric mixer and the water bath suggestion. It came out beautiful, no cracks, a little browning around the edges, but great!! It tastes fantastic too, the texture isn’t totally what it should be, but it’s forgivable because it tastes great! So for the moral of my story, if you get lumps, just keep going … it will probably turn out very tasty!! Thanks for the recipe, next time it will be even better:)

text:
I'm a cheesecake lover, although it's one thing I never attempted to make until recently. I purchased a spring form pan, reviewed recipes on this site and chose this one. I've had no trouble producing a crack free, lovely  textured cheesecake. I made a pumpkin cheesecake for Thanksgiving using this recipe base, and it was wonderful. Lots of compliments! I did follow advice from other reviews in regards to using a water bath and cracking the oven door when done and leaving the cake alone for at least an hour. I would really listen to the advice in regards to using a DOUBLE foil lining for the water bath. I used only one last time and had a little leaking.Thanks for the wonderful recipe!

country:
None
text:
Cream cheese is hard to find in the Czech Republic, and I only had 16oz to work with, so I halved the ingredients for the batter and it came out just fine. I followed other reviewers' advice and used a bain-marie when baking. It was easy to do and really did help prevent the cheesecake from cracking. After 45 minutes my cheesecake looked done, so I turned off the oven and let it sit for 2 hours (it was for Thanksgiving, so I needed the oven for other things and couldn't afford 5-6 hours), which was enough time. I took it out and put it in the fridge for a few more hours, then decorated by drizzling melted chocolate over the top. Everyone loved it!

country:
None
text:
Came out aswesome! I had NO cracks at all! After making sure everything is at room temperature, make sure you lightly mix everything in. Also, I did the water bath on the shelf below 20 minutes or so before putting in the cake. What I did was firmly run a stick of butter a few times all around the pan to make sure it was well greased!! I turned off the oven and didn't even take a peek until 5 hours later! Oh, if your ingredients aren't at room temperature, you can zap it in the microwave for a few seconds at a time and then mix; just enough to warm it closer to room temp. Anyway, It was gorgeous and perfect...not to mention delicious...I will be posting a pic ( in-Yang design).

I am trying it again with Chocolate chips and a cookie crust. Thanks for helping me impress my boss and my co-workers.

text:
This is the best classic cheesecake recipe I've tried.  I followed the advice of the some other reviewers and filled the lower tray with boiling water when I first turned the oven on.  I left the cake to cool in the oven for 3 hours (that's all the time I had) and was rewarded with a beautiful crack-free cake.  I also accidentally included 2 cups of sugar rather than the 1 1/2 cups - although the cake was on the sweeter side, it still tasted great!  I made a mango puree in a blender using two fresh ripe mangos, juice of half a lemon, some orange juice and a table spoon or two of white sugar (sweetness to taste) - yum!

text:
VERY GOOD recipe!  I did cook mine for the 1 hour at the specified tempature and then left in the closed oven for 5 hours without opening.  I also made sure all my ingredients were room tempature and tried to not overmix while mixing.  I placed a 9x9 pan with water in it on the rack below the cheesecake.  I did have one crack, but it wasn't terrible. I will try again to see if I can bake it without the crack.  The edges did get a little browner than I like, so I will lower the temp by 25 degrees for my next try.  This is a really good recipe, and I got GREAT reviews from everyone who tried it.

text:
Was my first time making cheesecake so was unsure what advice to follow from other reviews...now I know for next time - Bake at 325C - top was a little too dark for my liking - will add water bath on rack below - cake didn't crack, but extra moisture is a bonus, outside was slightly dry and will substitute cream for milk,at that point the cake has so many calories, might as well make it rich and creamy as possible! Made my own strawberry topping which was a huge hit. In the end everyone loved it, but I know from being an experienced enough cook that I can make it better. Will try again!

text:
OMG!!! I LOVE this cheesecake recipe.  This was my first time making a true cheesecake and it was so easy.  My cheesecake came out perfect - no cracks, excellent coloring, wonderful texture and awesome taste!  I followed the recipe exactly, with a few minor modifications: I added some brown sugar and cinammon to the graham cracker crust, substituted heavy cream for the milk, and did use a water bath underneath the cheesecake when baking and through the 5 to 6 hour cooling process. I will definitely use this recipe again and again and as a base for various flavors of cheesecake.  Thanks so much for sharing this one!

text:
AMAZING!  I love to bake but always end up overbaking every cheesecake I try.  This one turned out perfect.  I followed the directions and turned off the oven after an hour (even though the center was still very soupy) and it turned out perfect!  I did add 2 Tbsp of sugar to the crust and a tsp of lemon juice to the filling.  I also put a waterbath on the rack below the cheesecake.  It did end up cracking down the center, but I covered that up with some cherry pie filling and it was even better!  I will be making this again and again and again!  Thanks Chantal!!

userID:
1429503
Display Name:
Allison Buckley
isPro:
False
followersCount:
14
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
99
favoritesCount:
288
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/7221654.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
GREAT!  For crust I used 1.5 cups graham cracker crumbs, 1/4 cup melted unsalted butter, 1/4 cup sugar.  I baked with a baking pan with about an inch of water on bottom rack and cheesecake on middle rack.  No cracks.  Because of other reviews I removed the water bath after baking then closed oven and let sit 2 hours which I thought would be enough.  Next time I will NOT remove the water bath because I think it let all the heat escape from the oven.  And I will let it sit for the full 5-6 hours because it was just a little softer in the center than it was on the outer edges.  Also I used Pam cooking spray, wax paper on the bottom of the pan, and it did not stick to the pan whatsoever.

text:
This was a very good cheesecake.  Nice and smooth and creamy.  I used the water bath as recommended, and I didn't have a single crack.  I left it in the oven for about 4 hours to cool.  I also added some cinnamon and sugar and extra butter to the crust to jazz it up a bit.  I did run into a problem with the very center not setting as much as I would have liked.  I think I will bake for an extra 15 minutes or so the next time.  It is a beautiful looking cheesecake, that was very easy to make.

text:
About two weeks ago I stumbled upon this recipe and made it. Since then, I have made about five more from requests. I am not an experienced baker, I had never before made a cheesecake but not one of my cheesecakes cracked. Last night I whipped up another to take over my grandfather's house today and used a food processor. This was a mistake. While I was doing it, I could not believe how easy the food processor made it (I just figured out how to use the processor yesterday..lol..it has to be lined up and locked in for it to turn on..haha) Anyway, the cheesecake went from thick and delicious to absolutely the smoothist creamiest thing I have ever tasted. It also did not puff up as much while it was in the oven as when I use the hand mixer. I didn't give this recipe five stars because I think there are better tasting cheesecakes out there..my boyfriend's mom's is one of them, but this recipe is consistent and if followed correctly can come out beautiful.

text:
This cheesecake was amazing, and I've made quite a few good ones.  Follow other's suggestions using the water bath (I just put a pan of water on the rack below and wrapped the pan with foil). My only complaint was that it made WAY more than could fit in the pan.  My recommendation would be to cut the recipe by 1/3 to make one cake, or increase it 1/3 and make 2.  Otherwise there is a lot that goes to waste.  Good recipe!!!!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have never felt sooo flattered in my life than when I made this cheesecake. I mean EVERYONE (30+ guest) was raving that it was starting to make me shy and uncomfortable around the other guest that cooked sweets also. At least 5 women came up to me and asked for the recipe. And for all the people that wrote negative reviews, I am dumbfounded at how they could not think this was the best cheesecake ever (not just my opionion but from 30+ other guest). They must have messed up the directions, ingredients, or something. I cooked it the same as the recipe but with slight modifications for my own taste. I used Martha Stewarts recipe for the crust which is 2 cups of crushed graham crackers, 6 TB sugar, 1/3 cup butter, and 1/4 ts cinnamon. Which there is more crust to press into the bottom and sides of the springform pan. ALSO:The key directions in order for it not to get cracks is to OIL the sides and the bottom of the pan well. I don't use the water bath method because for some reason or another the water always gets in my pan even w/the aluminum foil. I cook it for 1 hour and let it sit in the over for at least 5 hours, then put in frig and it comes out to be a pretty and prefect cheesecake. Thanks so much for making me look like a better cook than I really am :)

text:
This cheesecake is terrifc. I made it for Thankgiving and it was wonderful. It is very easy to make. My cheesecake cracked but I think the problem was that I did not crack the oven open while it cooled. I would suggest letting it cool in the oven for 5-6 hours with the oven door cracked. It is best to make the cheesecake several days in advance so it can sit and solidify. The texture was great, creamy but still somewhat firm. I put fresh berries on top. I followed the tips that were suggested, which were very helpful. This cheesecake will now be a Thanksgiving tradition.

Mine came out perfect with no cracks.  I did all of my mixing by hand with a wisk, and had no trouble at all.  I did not have the correct pan, so I just used a normal nine inch circular pan and used less crust materials and less filling.  I *never* opened the oven, cooked it for 50 minutes (because there were less ingredients than called for) and let it sit in the unopened oven for five hours.  It is *very* tasty, but not *quite* as good as my favorite cheesecake that comes from a candy shop downtown.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Well, I made this cake last night for a birthday dinner and it turned out quite nicely, however, I wouldn't call this a new york cheesecake.  This isn't as dense or rich as a New York cheesecake, and it has a crust.

I made the cake according to the instructions, with the exception of baking.  I used a water bath to help prevent browning and cracking and only left it in the oven for three hours, before removing and allowing to cool completely (on the counter).  I didn't have time to refridgerate before the dinner, so I threw it into the freezer for two hours and it turned out just fine.  

Everyone raved about it at dinner, including the staff at the restaurant where we went to eat.

I love cheesecake!  This was pretty good... I did add some sugar to the crust and used 2 cups of graham cracker crumbs.  I also added half a lemon to the cheesecake mix.  I did this all in my food processor and I think I overbeat because I got bubbles and the top browned pretty badly.  I used a water bath and all but my pan was off to the side.  Maybe that's why it browned? I also let this cool in the oven for 4 hours. This was my first time making a cheesecake so I'll continue using this recipe to perfect it. It's really smooth and creamy though!  Very filling.

text:
This is a really great cheesecake recipe.  It was easy, delicious, and did not require too many ingredients.  I didn't make any changes to the original recipe except I didn't have a 9-inch springform pan so I resulted to a 10 3/4 inch springform pan which was actually the perfect size and made a large, thick cheesecake.  My only problem was a crack in the center although I did keep it in the oven for 4 hours after baking it.  I served the cake chilled with a warm vanilla sauce on the side and everyone seemed to really enjoy it.  There was only a few pieces and we only had 8 people!  In the end, this was an easy, fantastic cake and I will be making it again shortly!!!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The crust?  Well, I'm still working on it.  I used 3 cups + 2 Tbsp. graham cracker crumbs, 3 Tbsp. melted butter, and 3/8 cups sugar (6 Tbsp).  I like it sweet and I like a LOT of it, but this was just TOO much crust.  The top 1/2 of the crust soaked up a little moisture from the cake making it JUST right but the bottom half was just crumbs.  NOT good!  Next time I'll try 2 cups of crumbs, 2 tbsp. of butter, and 1/4 cup sugar.  I'll report back next time I make it (which will be 7/23/05 for a birthday!)

Wish me luck!
Laurel

P.S.  No cracks and PERFECT color (no browning)
P.S.  No cracks and PERFECT color (no browning)

text:
Just made this this weekend for a birthday party.  It was my first cheesecake and it turned out fantastic!  Tastes just the way a cheesecake should taste.

I made sure that my ingredients were pretty close to room temp. and baked it in a water bath and did let it cool in the oven for about 4 hours and it came out beautiful - no cracking at all.  (I also followed someone else's suggestion and got a Reynold's oven bag and had no problem with water leaking in.)

I can't wait to make it again!

I overbeat it (through ignorance), my springform pan leaked about a quarter of the mixture into the bottom of my oven and my oven was too hot and so when it cooled it developed the Grand Canyon of cracks in it. HOWEVER, it tasted great and got rave reviews from the whole extended family.  So thanks Chantal, I'll definitely be trying it again.

Display Name:
SALYEO
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614249.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
i used 125g of oreo cookies (without cream) and 60g of butter for the crust. I can hardly get sour cream in my town so i substituted it with juice of 1 lemon plus enough milk to make a cup of home-made sour cream =P 
the batter was kinda watery and i was actually worrying that i might yield a soggy cheesecake. However, i followed the instructions and baked in water bath for 1 hour and another additional 10 mins... and let it stand in the oven to cool for around 2++ hours, then refrigerated it. 
The cake had a very smooth surface and it didnt crack at all!! I topped it with  a whole can of blueberry pie fillings and the cake was awesome all i can say!! my parents love it so much! i actually made this for Mother's Day =) 
Anyways, the texture was just nice and best served chilled. When i left it to room temperature it becomes too soft and the texture was not so smooth. (maybe the weather in my country is pretty hot... I'm frm Malaysia with 30C all the time) 
I definitely would use this recipe again  but i will make a little changes. I'm going to try substituting the milk with whipping cream instead, hopefully i can yield a smoother plus harder textured cake which can stand the hot weather when i am serving it out =)

text:
This is really the type of cheescake you would get in a deli or at Sam's Club. Mine came out pretty creamy. I reduced the sugar to 1 cup and baked it at 400F for 15 min then reduced it to 225F for another 50 minutes. I find that if you bake at 350 or even 325 it would crack and the top would get really brown. I also baked it in a waterbath. I would have given it 5 stars but I like a lighter cheesecake. Thanks for the recipe!

Display Name:
DYZFUNCK

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674136.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
It was my first time baking cheesecake ever, and I can tell you that I wasn't put off by it. It turned out splendidly with a water bath. I did one batch in a springform pan (with water bath) and the remaining mixture I used to bake cheesecake muffins (without water bath). My muffins cracked at the start, and once I turned off the oven and let it stand, they began to sink in the middle, though there was no browning at all. Maybe this was coz of the absence of the water bath, and so the oven heat was harsher on the muffins, or maybe coz they were small in size, don't know. But I'm sticking to water baths from now on although it never compromised on taste - just the presentation. I like the tangy flavor of some cheesecakes, so I added 3 tbsps of fresh lemon juice and dumped in some lemon rind into the mixture. Instead of graham crackers or vanilla wafers, I used crushed Digestive cookies mixed with a little cinnamon and some fine sugar. I baked the bigger cake for an hour (as I did the muffins), it never cracked, no harsh brown spots. My family loves it!

text:
My daughter requested cheesecake for her graduation party and I'd never made it before ... but I definitely will again!  This is a fabulous basic recipe.

I followed the previously suggested crust variations of using cinnamon grahams & adding 1/4 c. ground nuts, plus a bit more sugar & butter.  For the batter, I added the juice & grated rind of one lime (for a total of 3/4 c. liquid including milk).

I did use the water bath & let it sit in the oven for a couple of hours after I turned the oven off & ran a knife around the edge--even with 2 layers of heavy duty foil, water snuck in!  Well, not really--the pan was sitting in a bit of syrup when I took it out of the oven, so I left it in one layer of foil & covered it with the other (handy!) until I unmolded it.  Water sure is sneaky stuff!  I ran the knife around the edge again before refrigerating it for a day and it did NOT crack.

Thank you, Chantal, for the recipe--and thank you, previous reviewers, for great suggestions!
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2004-06-02T18:32:38.95

575848

Luv2Quilt

city:

None
country:
None
text:
Look no further!  This recipe, and the Chocolate Chip Cheesecake I (listed here) are the best cheesecakes by far.  I prefer the chocolate chip kind, but I make this one more often because it's the most requested.  I'm getting to be known as the cheesecake lady!  Open a can of canned pie filling, like cherries or blueberries, for individual slices, and it's really a hit!  I don't keep the cheesecake in the oven after it's done as long as the recipe calls for.  I find that the cake will split no matter what, but nobody knows because it's cut up anyway.  An hour or so in the oven to cool will suffice and then to the refrigerator.  I can't imagine a better cheesecake than this one!

text:
An OK recipe.  Too cream cheesy for my taste buds.  And mine didn't come out very smooth...my flour went all lumpy when I stirred it in.  But, I had NO CRACKS...and I didn't cool it as it called for.  I cooled it in shut off over for about an hour..then took it out for a bit, then put it in fridge while it was still quite hot..turned out great.  I added sugar to my crust, and it was yummy, but would bake it a bit next time..it came out kinda soggy.  A very filling cheesecake. I don't think I will make this one again, I liked the Basic Cheesecake much better(on this site).

text:
while the flavor was o.k. my cheesecake came out very dry and full of cracks.  I've never left a cheesecake in the oven for that long of time, but decided to follow the recipe to the letter.  The cracks don't bother me because I alway use a sour cream topping to hide any flaws plus I like the flavor, but the dry crumbly texture was disapointing to me.  Also, there was too much batter for my springform pan so I put the extra in a pre-made Oreo cust with some mini chocolate chips and baked for 1/2 hour it came out creamy and perfect.  I will try this recipe again but will not leave it in the turned off oven for 6 hours.

Great recipe!  I wanted to make a smaller version of this recipe since only I was going to eat.  So I made 3 servings instead of 12.  However I still cooked it in a 9 inch pan, so each slice was really thin.  It was still so yummy and the portions were much more doable.  I only cooked it for 45 minutes at 350 and I used low fat cream cheese.  Oh, and I didn't use a water bath and I had no cracks..  Thanks for the recipe Chantal!

text:
Update!  After doing a bit of research, I found that when a cheescake recipe includes flour, it should be baked in a water bath.  What a difference it has made!  I have been making this recipe for four years and it is still the BEST EVER!  Thanks Chantal!Although time-consuming, this is an excellent recipe!  I make it once a month!

text:
I am not a cook, but decided to try my husband's favorite cheesecake for his birthday.  He loved it!  I am so proud.  The other reviews really helped.  I was afraid of the water bath so I put a 9x13 pan of boiling water on the rack below and no cracks!  Also after the first hour of baking, I shut the oven off and DID NOT OPEN the door for 5 hours.  Now I am confident to make this essentially very easy recipe again and again.  Thanks Chantal and everyone else.

text:
I loved the taste.  Good, thick, creamy texture.  Classic cheesecake.  I didn't leave mine in the oven for six hours like the recipe asked.  After an hour of cooking, I turned off the oven and an hour later I checked and the middle was runny.  I didn't want to take the chance that it wouldn't be cooked through so I cooked for an additional 30 minutes at 350.  It still tastes great and looked wonderful!

text:
This was excellent.  Very easy to prepare.  I used chocolate crumbs instead of graham crumbs and I don't think I would do that again.  I served it with a raspberry coulis and was delicious.  Instead of baking in a water bath I just put a pan of water on the rack below and my cake came out crackless.  Definitely a keeper.  I think I agree with another reviewer though, I think I would decrease the vanilla next time and maybe have a little more tanginess of the cream cheese coming through.

text:
This recipe is absolutely the BEST! It's flavor is far superior than anything you could possibly buy. This is a classic that will stay in my family for years to come! I definitely recommend it to everyone. The only thing I see that needs changed is the temperature, if you have a dark pan it needs lowered or it will crack, 350 degrees is too high (try 330-340 degrees). Delicious with blueberry topping. Also, don't use 'lite' cream cheese, save calories elsewhere and not on this!

text:
I never bake a cake before not even a cheesecake, so this one is my first. I am totally ecstatic that it comes out perfect (I did cartwheels). I made them using Braun blender, add 5 eggs instead of 4, and put them all in room temperature. I don't gave my cheesecake a bath but I put a pot of boiling water underneath a rack. My cheesecake never crack, good texture and above all good taste. I made them while I'm sick with a cranky baby who was also sick and later admitted in the hospital the next morning. But Chantal's cheesecake really boost my energy. I shared with my family members and in laws (each had one sliced) and they love it although my diabetic mom said it's too sweet, it's not actually. Thanks Chantal for sharing the great recipe, it's going to be a keeper.

Excellent! The Cheese cake was a hit in the family. Hint for foreigners (especially Germans...): If you can't get Graham crackers, you can use smashed up butter keks for the bottom. But you have to be careful pooring the cream cheese filling on top of it so that you don't stirr up the crumbs.

text:
My mom requested a cheesecake as her mother's day present this year.  This recipe is absolutely fabulous and so easy to make!!  I used "lite" sour cream and 24 oz cream cheese & 8 oz 1/3 less fat cream cheese.  I baked it at 325 degrees for 50 mins (w/ no water bath), and it turned out brown on the top...but it didn't crack!  It's creamy and delicious; my mom loves it!

there was a lot of cracking though so i might try making it in a water bath next time. did not care much for crust's taste. would add some sugar. 
really loved the cheesecake and everyone that tried it thought it was absolutely awesome.
